headline: FDA approves injectable version of Bristol Myers Squibb's cancer drug Opdivo (Dec. 27)
summary: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday that it has approved an injectable version of Bristol Myers Squibb's blockbuster cancer drug, Opdivo.  Opdivo is part of a class of drugs called PD-1 inhibitors, which enhance the immune system's ability to fight cancer by removing its natural brakes.
